definitions: point out or show something especially by using a sign or gesture
be a sign or symptom of something or suggest that something exists
examples: The sign indicates where visitors should park their cars
She indicated the correct answer with a nod
Dark clouds indicate that a storm is approaching
These results indicate a need for further research

definitions: have objective reality or being in the physical or conceptual world
examples: Life exists on Earth in many different forms
Does intelligent life exist elsewhere in the universe

definitions: take something away or off from the position occupied physically
eliminate or get rid of something unwanted or dismiss from position
examples: Please remove your shoes before entering the house
The dentist will remove the tooth next week
We need to remove all obstacles to progress
The board voted to remove him from office

definitions: keep away from or stop oneself from doing something deliberately
prevent something from happening or stop something undesirable from occurring
examples: Try to avoid crowded places during flu season
She avoids talking about her past experiences
Good planning helps avoid mistakes in the project
Careful driving can avoid accidents on icy roads

definitions: allow or enable to escape from confinement or set free from restraint
make information or a product available to the public officially
examples: The zoo will release the rehabilitated eagle tomorrow
Press the button to release the emergency brake
The company will release their new product next month
The government released the report to the media

definitions: behave toward or deal with someone in a particular way
give medical care or attention to someone for illness or injury
provide someone with food drink or entertainment as a special gesture
examples: You should treat everyone with respect and kindness
The company treats its employees very well
The doctor will treat your infection with antibiotics
This hospital treats patients with rare diseases
Let me treat you to dinner for your birthday
She treated the children to ice cream

definitions: feel intense or passionate dislike for someone or something strongly
examples: I hate waiting in long lines at the store
Many people hate the sound of fingernails on chalkboard

definitions: go to see and spend time with someone socially or professionally
access a website or web page on the internet for information
examples: We visit my grandparents every Sunday afternoon
The doctor visits patients in the hospital ward
Millions of people visit this website every day
Please visit our online store for special offers

definitions: reach a place at the end of a journey or trip
happen or occur at a particular time or moment finally
examples: The train arrives at the station at noon
We arrived home safely after the long drive
Spring arrives early in the southern regions
The moment of truth has finally arrived

definitions: become aware of something or someone by seeing or observing
give formal warning or information about something officially in advance
examples: Did you notice the new painting in the hallway
I noticed she seemed upset during the meeting
You must give two weeks' notice before leaving
The landlord sent a notice about rent increase

definitions: have an effect on or make a difference to something or someone
touch the feelings of someone or move emotionally in some way
examples: Weather conditions affect crop yields every year
The new policy will affect all employees
The sad movie deeply affected the audience
Her kindness affected him more than words could

definitions: plan and make decisions about how something will look or function
plan or intend something for a particular purpose or effect deliberately
examples: She designs beautiful wedding dresses for clients
Engineers design bridges to withstand earthquakes
This course is designed for beginners
The law was designed to protect consumers

definitions: say or write something as an answer to someone or something
react quickly or positively to a stimulus or treatment effectively
examples: Please respond to the email by Friday
She responded to his question with a smile
The patient is responding well to treatment
Markets respond quickly to economic changes

definitions: have the power to influence or direct behavior or events
limit regulate or keep something within certain bounds effectively
examples: Parents control what their young children watch
The pilot controls the aircraft during flight
We need to control spending to stay within budget
This medicine helps control blood pressure

definitions: be responsible for controlling or organizing someone or something effectively
succeed in surviving or in achieving something despite difficult circumstances
examples: She manages a team of twenty employees
He manages the family business very efficiently
How did you manage to finish so quickly
We managed to arrive just before the storm

definitions: display a notice or sign in a public place for information
send a letter or parcel via the postal system to someone
publish or make available on the internet or social media platform
examples: They post announcements on the bulletin board
The company posts job openings on their website
I'll post the letter on my way to work
Remember to post the birthday card today
She posts photos on social media every day
He posted an interesting article on his blog

definitions: accept something as true without proof or take for granted
take or begin to have power or responsibility officially
examples: Don't assume everyone agrees with your opinion
I assumed you knew about the meeting
She will assume the role of director next month
The vice president assumes duties during absence

definitions: carry out accomplish or fulfill an action task or function
present a form of entertainment to an audience publicly
examples: Surgeons perform complex operations every day
The machine performs multiple functions efficiently
The band will perform at the festival tonight
She performs magic tricks at children's parties

definitions: rest with your eyes closed and mind and body inactive naturally
examples: Most adults need seven to eight hours sleep nightly
The baby sleeps peacefully in her crib

definitions: make previously unknown or secret information known to others publicly
allow something hidden to be seen by uncovering or exposing it
examples: The investigation revealed corruption at high levels
She finally revealed her true feelings
Opening the curtains revealed a beautiful view
The x-ray revealed a fracture in the bone

definitions: have or hold someone or something within as a part or ingredient
control or restrain oneself or one's feelings from being expressed
examples: This box contains all my childhood photographs
The recipe contains several exotic spices
She couldn't contain her excitement about the news
Try to contain your anger during the discussion

definitions: strike someone or something repeatedly to hurt or damage them
defeat or do better than someone in a competition or conflict
mix something vigorously with repeated movements using a utensil
examples: The rain beat against the window all night
His heart beats faster when he's nervous
Our team beat theirs by ten points
She beat all the other candidates for the job
Beat the eggs until they're light and fluffy
Beat the cream until it forms stiff peaks

definitions: make or become better in quality condition or standard through effort
examples: Regular practice will improve your piano skills
The weather should improve by the weekend

definitions: move in a specified direction or toward a particular place
be in charge of or at the front of an organization
examples: We should head home before it gets dark
The ship headed north toward the arctic
She heads the marketing department at the company
Who will head the new committee

definitions: speak to a person or group formally or deliver a speech
think about and begin to deal with an issue or problem
examples: The president will address the nation tonight
Please address your questions to the panel
We need to address these concerns immediately
The report addresses several important issues

definitions: give an account of or tell a story or sequence of events
have a connection association or reference to something else logically
examples: She related the whole story to her friends
He relates his experiences in the book
These two events relate to each other
I can't relate to his point of view

definitions: lift and set down one's foot to move or walk somewhere
take a particular action or measure to achieve something
examples: Step carefully on the icy sidewalk
She stepped into the elevator quickly
We must step up our efforts to succeed
The government will step in if necessary

definitions: bring together parts or combine to create or shape something
gradually appear or come into existence through natural processes
examples: Children form friendships easily at school
We need to form a committee for this project
Clouds form when water vapor condenses
Ice forms on the lake in winter

definitions: devote time and attention to gaining knowledge through books or examination
look at or examine something carefully in detail to understand it
examples: She studies medicine at the university
Students study hard before final exams
Scientists study the effects of climate change
He studied her face for signs of emotion

definitions: set up an organization system or set of rules on a permanent basis
show something to be true or certain by determining the facts
examples: They want to establish a new branch office
The university was established in 1850
The police need to establish the facts
Research established a link between the factors

definitions: attach or fasten something to something else using an adhesive substance
push a sharp or pointed object into or through something firmly
remain in a particular position or continue without changing or moving
examples: Stick the stamp on the envelope
The poster won't stick to the wall
She stuck a pin through the fabric
Don't stick your finger in the socket
I'll stick with my original decision
The nickname stuck throughout his life

definitions: prepare and issue a book journal or piece of music for public sale
examples: The author will publish her new novel next year
Scientific journals publish research findings monthly

definitions: produce musical sounds with the voice especially words with a melody
examples: She sings beautifully in the church choir
Birds sing early in the morning

definitions: find something or someone unexpectedly or in the course of a search
become aware of a fact or situation for the first time
examples: Columbus discovered America in 1492
Scientists discovered a new species of frog
I discovered that my wallet was missing
She discovered her passion for painting

definitions: keep something in good condition by checking or repairing it regularly
continue to have or do something or keep at the same level
examples: You must maintain your car for safety
The company maintains all equipment regularly
She maintains a positive attitude despite challenges
We must maintain high standards of quality

definitions: move through the air using wings or be carried by the wind
travel in an aircraft or pilot an aircraft through the air
examples: Birds fly south for the winter
The kite flies high in the strong wind
We fly to Paris tomorrow morning
She learned to fly helicopters in the military

definitions: expressing the future tense or strong intention determination or obligation
examples: We shall overcome these difficulties together
You shall receive your payment next week

definitions: come into existence through birth or be brought into life naturally
examples: She was born in Paris in 1990
Three puppies were born last night

definitions: confess to be true or to be the case typically reluctantly
allow someone to enter a place or join an organization officially
examples: He finally admitted his mistake to everyone
I must admit you were right
The university admits thousands of students annually
This ticket admits two people to the concert

definitions: have something as one's possession or property legally or rightfully
examples: They own a beautiful house by the lake
She owns three successful restaurants

definitions: take measures to check the quality performance or reliability of something
try out or put to the proof to discover capabilities or properties
examples: Teachers test students at the end of term
They test all products before shipping
Let's test this theory with an experiment
Test the water before diving in

definitions: move or cause to move rapidly back and forth or up and down
upset the composure of someone or make them feel emotionally disturbed
examples: Shake the bottle before opening it
The earthquake shook buildings for miles
The terrible news shook her deeply
His confidence was shaken by the failure

definitions: move something into position to block an opening or close tightly
examples: Please shut the door quietly behind you
She shut her eyes and made a wish

definitions: make a journey typically of some length to different places
move or progress in a particular way or at a particular rate
examples: They travel to Europe every summer
She travels frequently for business meetings
Light travels faster than sound
News travels quickly in small towns

definitions: put or keep out of sight to conceal from view or discovery
keep secret or prevent from being known or noticed by others
examples: Children love to hide during hide-and-seek games
She hides presents in the closet before birthdays
Don't hide your feelings from your partner
He tried to hide the truth about his past

definitions: mention or allude to someone or something in speech or writing
direct someone to a different person or source for information help or action
examples: She referred to her notes during the presentation
The article refers to several research studies
The doctor will refer you to a specialist
Please refer to page ten for more details

definitions: take liquid into the mouth and swallow it for refreshment or nourishment
consume alcohol especially habitually or to excess in social situations
examples: Drink plenty of water during hot weather
The baby drinks milk every three hours
They drink wine with dinner on weekends
He doesn't drink anymore since last year

definitions: keep something from happening or arising through advance planning or action
examples: Vaccines prevent many serious diseases
Good security measures prevent theft

definitions: come into or be in physical contact with something using hands
affect or move someone emotionally in a gentle or subtle way
examples: Don't touch the wet paint on the wall
She gently touched his shoulder
His story touched everyone in the audience
The movie touched on important social issues

definitions: experience or be subjected to physical or mental pain continuously
experience or be subjected to something bad or unpleasant unavoidably
examples: She suffers from chronic back pain
Many people suffer from anxiety
The economy suffered during the recession
His reputation suffered after the scandal
